image.altText: Two men hugging

props.synopsis: Israel is refusing to take responsibility for the drone strike that killed Hamas kingpin Saleh al-Arouri, but his death does follow a vow from Israeli officials to hunt down those involved in the October 7 attack.

title.children: A Hamas leader thought he was safe. His death may suggest a global assassination campaign is underway

image.altText: An aerial shot of a city skyline in the distance, with houses and parklands in the foreground

props.synopsis: Perth house prices are being boosted by growing interest from east coast buyers, many of whom have no plans to relocate interstate — and a local settlement agent says she has never seen anything like it.

title.children: East coast investors with no intention of moving west are fuelling Perth's latest property boom

image.altText: More revelations in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation

props.synopsis: A US court is releasing the names of dozens of people with ties to deceased financier Jeffrey Epstein a move that could reveal new details about his sex trafficking.

title.children: Names of Jeffrey Epstein's associates released in court documents spanning more than 900 pages

image.altText: An aerial photo of a destroyed plane on the ground

props.synopsis: A transcript of communication between air traffic control and two aircraft that collided and burst into flames at Tokyo’s Haneda Airport sheds some light on how the incident unfolded. Here's what it says.

title.children: Air traffic control transcript suggests only one plane had permission to be on runway before deadly Japan collision

image.altText: David Warner walks off the field as the crowd applauds and his name is visible on the hoardings

props.synopsis: David Warner is dismissed for potentially the final time in Test cricket on day two of the SCG Test between Australia and Pakistan. Follow live.

title.children: SCG Test halted by bad light on day two after Warner and Khawaja fall

image.altText: Andrew and Nicola stand side by side on the Perth foreshore

props.synopsis: After slowly increasing their stake in Australian Agricultural Company for the past three years, the mining magnates' shareholding increased to 19.5 per cent this week — just under the takeover threshold of 20pc.

title.children: Billionaires Andrew 'Twiggy' and Nicola Forrest increase stake in Australia's largest cattle company

image.altText: Lightning strike near home roofs in Blue Mountains

props.synopsis: It's understood the group were holding onto a metal railing when the storm hit "almost without warning".

title.children: Blue Mountains tourists struck by lightning in storm that came 'almost without warning'

image.altText: Alex de Minaur stretches for a backhand at the United Cup.

props.synopsis: Twelve months on from a harrowing loss to Novak Djokovic, Alex de Minaur is riding a wave of confidence after beating the world number one for the first time in his career.

title.children: De Minaur goes from embarrassment to ecstasy after defeating Djokovic

image.altText: black and white picture of man with barbed fence and prison cell behind

props.synopsis: Dean Williams was excited to be released from prison, but then he was filled with fear from the pressures of life on the outside.

title.children: In the days before his release from prison, Dean had a lot of questions swirling in his head

image.altText: A man draped in a Ukranian flag hugs a man in army fatigues among other released prisoners of war

props.synopsis: Russia's Defence Ministry says 248 military personnel were handed over by Ukraine and Kyiv said it had brought home 224 soldiers and six civilians in the largest documented swap of troops in the conflict so far.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine exchange hundreds of prisoners of war

image.altText: red chicken eyeballs camera

props.synopsis: When a trailer of hens overturned on a NSW highway, it was up to two animal lovers to rescue them, over five nights of dodging B-double trucks and crawling through thick undergrowth.

title.children: 80 chickens stranded on motorway median strip couldn't cross the road — until two women came to their rescue

image.altText: A low angle view of the outside fence of Elmore Correctional Facility at daytime

props.synopsis: Plans to execute a convicted murderer by asphyxiating him with nitrogen may amount to "cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment" or even torture, experts say.

title.children: 'A painful and humiliating death': UN experts call for first US execution by nitrogen gas to be halted

image.altText: A woman with black hair in a white blazer speaks with her hands.

props.synopsis: The former 90210 actor has shared an update about her treatment journey after the cancer spread to her bones in November.

title.children: Actor Shannen Doherty hopes for 'three to five more years' after stage 4 cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A prince and princess wave to the crowd

props.synopsis: Mary Donaldson sought out a deportment course in Sydney's Darlinghurst soon after meeting Denmark's Crown Prince Frederik in Sydney, to "transform her life".

title.children: How Princess Mary trained at a Sydney deportment school to become the future queen of Denmark

image.altText: A man cries and hugs a child, another older man holds onto a crying man by the wrist

props.synopsis: Two explosions in Iran kill almost 100 people, and injure more than 200 others, at a ceremony honouring a top military commander who was killed by a US drone strike in 2020.

title.children: Iran vows revenge as nearly 100 killed in blasts at ceremony honouring slain general

image.altText: Two children walk past rubble at a refugee camp in central Gaza strip

props.synopsis: The question for Israel's government is how its campaign against Hamas — and its horrifying civilian toll — will prevent a new generation of people taking up arms? The answer, according to anti-terror experts, is not via military means, writes Eric Tlozek.

title.children: The key question Israel must ask about its Gaza strategy

image.altText: A man walks through destruction and rubble

props.synopsis: Through bitter cold and heavy rain, rescuers continue to search the rubble of collapsed homes in western Japan in the hopes of finding survivors of this week’s earthquake.

title.children: Japan earthquake death toll rises to 77 as search for survivors enters fourth day

image.altText: Blue Scuti reacting after making the game Tetris freeze

props.synopsis: Video shows the teen playing the video game on a Nintendo Entertainment System console until it froze — not because it was broken — but because he'd reached such a high level the game just couldn't keep going.

title.children: 'Something only AI can do': 13-year-old 'beats' Tetris

image.altText: Cooked fish and chips with lemon

props.synopsis: Eating fresh fish and chips beside the sea is an Australian tradition. But dwindling supply and rising industry costs mean other meats are now being sold at many seafood shops.

title.children: With meat on the menu, is it the end of the fish-and-chip shop as we know it?

image.altText: A woman on a white horse catches the ball with her polocrosse racquet. A male player on a brown horse is close behind her.

props.synopsis: Australia is heading to the Polocrosse World Cup but training poses some unique logistical challenges — with the coach, players and their horses based large distances apart.

title.children: How Australia's top polocrosse coach gets players world cup-ready from the other side of the country

image.altText: A man in a suit sits next to a blonde woman

props.synopsis: The maverick independent MP says the government needs to support his demands for mandatory CCTV in abattoirs and a cessation on AFL projects until the Macquarie Point stadium passes parliament.

title.children: Tasmanian MP John Tucker threatens to 'bring the government down' over CCTV in abattoirs, AFL deals

image.altText: Pedro Arroyo with hip hop artist Royal El Latino

props.synopsis: He's been stabbed twice, shot at, and had to defuse wild brawls. But while Brisbane-based Pedro Arroyo's career has not been all smiles, there have been plenty of "amazing" experiences.

title.children: Security guard to stars lists Foo Fighters, Bon Jovi, Ed Sheeran among favourites to visit Queensland

image.altText: Uniformed army personnel discuss plans while standing near a defence truck

props.synopsis: More than 6,000 homes and businesses are still without power more than a week after powerful Christmas holiday storms ripped through Queensland's south-east.

title.children: Defence force arrives in south-east Queensland to aid storm recovery as thousands remain without power

image.altText: Nic Welch holds a life jacket

props.synopsis: Queensland tourism operators are feeling forgotten and ignored by governments after devastating storms destroyed what should be their most lucrative time of year.

title.children: This small Queensland business has lost thousands in less than a fortnight and its next busiest period is 'quite some time away'

image.altText: A pastel pink front door to a white multi-storey weatherboard house. 'Maison de rose' sign on the right

props.synopsis: It's easy to watch home DIY shows and marvel at — and maybe judge — the bold choices people make. But stamping your personality on your home doesn't need to involve big renovations.

title.children: Renovating these holidays? Here are some low-risk, high-reward ideas to put a stamp on your home

image.altText: zarah now

props.synopsis: When Zarah's beloved tight curls grew back differently after chemotherapy treatment, she felt like she was losing part of herself.

title.children: Zarah's hair changed after chemo. Wigs reconnect her to the hair she loved but lost

image.altText: A Tesla charger

props.synopsis: Australia's share market slips backwards following losses on major US indices overnight, and bomb blasts in Iran have increased tensions in the Middle East.

title.children: Electric car sales almost triple in 2023, while the ASX loses value as Middle East bomb blasts add to global tensions

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Electric car sales almost triple in 2023

image.altText: A close-up of a baby's hand holding onto an adult's fingers.

props.synopsis: A 62-year-old woman is given permission to have sperm extracted from her dead husband to conceive a baby, after the couple lost their two adult children in separate accidents.

title.children: Australian woman, 62, whose husband died suddenly wins legal permission to extract his sperm

image.altText: A selfie taken by a woman with black hair and earrings next to an older man in glasses and both of them are smiling.

props.synopsis: A family trip to Malaysia becomes a crisis when Kelly Eng and her ageing parents are thrown into physical combat against men in balaclavas carrying machetes.

title.children: Kelly thought her father was getting old. Then she saw him fight off machete-wielding thieves

image.altText: A Tasmania Police officer stands in front of a patrol car in Hobart's CBD.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police has confirmed the officer is the subject of an internal professional standards investigation in relation to the alleged incident.

title.children: Senior female police officer stood down after harassment allegations at end-of-year social function

image.altText: A crowd gathers on a river bank.

props.synopsis: Three women and four men were hospitalised after contracting the non-contagious disease from potentially contaminated cooling towers.

title.children: Legionnaires' disease outbreak linked to Sydney CBD puts thousands on health alert

image.altText: Man holds up tennis racket cheering in red shirt

props.synopsis: Former Australian tennis player John Alexander says rules governing how medical timeouts are used in tennis need to be changed after Novak Djokovic's win against Jiri Lehecka following a wrist injury.

title.children: Former Australian great says medical timeout rules need to be changed because of Djokovic

image.altText: A film still of Adam Driver, with white hair and sunglasses, his arms folded, and Gabriel Leone, in a leather jacket and sunnies

props.synopsis: Adam Driver stars as Enzo Ferrari in director Michael Mann's take on the legacy of the eponymous racing-car mogul.

title.children: Speed, sleek cars and a persistent sense of impending doom: Adam Driver stars in Ferrari
